name: Red Stone Online
description: Red Stone is an online 2.5D Ultimate Transformation MMORPG! The story of Red Stone begins in the fantasy world of Prandel as players go on an adventurous quest to search for a mystical red stone that fell from the Celestial World.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7, Windows XP, Windows Vista Processor: Pentium3 600MHz Memory: 1 GB RAM Graphics: compatible with Direct X 9.0 or above DirectX: Version 9.0 Network: Broadband Internet connection Storage: 2 GB available space
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows 7, Windows XP, Windows Vista Processor: Pentium3 800MHz Memory: 1 GB RAM Graphics: compatible with Direct X 9.0 or above DirectX: Version 9.0 Network: Broadband Internet connection Storage: 4 GB available space

reviews.review_text: Fun and challenging, I have a great time playing this game. I only dislike one thing which is the armour layout, but other than that great game and will keep playing it.

This game gets a very negative feedback from me for the problems I have experienced trying to log in. First the game client crashes when you try to log in if you are not in administrative mode. Something I can easily deal with and hindred only the first launch. Then came the log on creation where I went to the website only to be bombarded several times by 'DO YOU WANT TO MAKE A NEW ACCOUNT' screen, after I was already making a new account. That annoyed me but still did not hinder me. So, after doing all this, I still could not log in game itself as it didn't recognize my username/password. It also seemed to bug out every third or so login attempt.   Finally, and what took the cake is this 'X-Trap'. This horrid horrid game protection is actually not really protection. It prevents typing outside the game screen. This seems to include steam related screens. How this got past being greenlit, I will never understand. Oh, and to top it off, there is no wiki for this game. The wikis are completely unfurbished or barely have anything other than copied text from the website over at GamenGame.  In short, if you have the patience, the luck, and the mashocist attitude to play this, go ahead. But for a casual gamer like myself, I say stay away~

I was thrilled to see this game on Steam before and back again! xD since the starting field changed,it became much easier to start with!! look forward to participating the event they are holding as well. go REDSTONE go!

One of the worse 2D MMO games I have played. Not only the game window is small but navigation around maps is tricky. I agree the quests are repetitive. There is no interesting content which make me want to lv to 600.

pros +Gameplay old-school feeling +Lots of classes +Quests +well designed maps  cons - Translation issues the names of NPC's are sometimes different then in the Quest log  seems hard at first but when you get used to it, the game got it's charm would most def. recommend this game to players who like the diablo feeling in games :)

it reminds me of the period that i played DIABLO1. it's true that the graphic is not that attractive compared to other 3D games that we could easily play these days, but the contents are unique. tutorial was bit boring, but after then, found out there are many quests to complete which makes this game interesting. Choose from many classes to suit your own taste (i chose Maid to play) and the community here is friendly. (found GMs at main place and training centre to help newbies) Well i recommend! 8/10
i love this game i been with it since the good old beta days and its still awsome theres so much to do. and the community is great always helpful.
Barely got into login screen but then cant create an account. This must be the worst designed login mechanics ive ever come across.

A 2.5d MMORPG unlike any other. This game has interactive Game Masters, a plethora of unique classes, and an endless amount of content to explore. Reaching all the way up to level 999, the possibilities for playstyles within just one class are nearly limitless. If you're looking for a great game with low computer requirements, this may be the game for you. It plays similar to ARPGs like Diablo in the sense that you move via mouse clicks, instead of the popular WASD fashion.   Players can join guilds, form parties, and explore content together or alone.  Overall, this game has a solid 8.75 from me, only losing points due to the somewhat poor translations on things. Definitely pick this game up and at least give it a try.  The only other qualm aside from translations that I have, is that after a certain point, it tends to require a bit of money to level efficiently.(Buying a Portal Sphere, often referred to as 'Prem'.)
it's a slow empty mmo with bad gameplay. completly wast of time.
This game is suprisingly cool. Doesn't look like it but it is.
